firestore.reasoning:
The Firestore structure is designed to ensure authorization independence, clarity, and QAP support. It leverages path-based ownership for user data and quiz-related entities, and denormalization to avoid hierarchical authorization dependencies. The structure also segregates data based on access needs and employs consistent access modeling.

Users are stored in a dedicated collection (`/users/{userId}`) with their associated data. Quizzes are stored in a dedicated collection (`/quizzes/{quizId}`). Questions are stored as subcollections under each quiz (`/quizzes/{quizId}/questions/{questionId}`), and QuizTranslations are also stored as subcollections under each quiz (`/quizzes/{quizId}/translations/{translationId}`).

This design enables secure `list` operations by segregating data with different access requirements into separate collections or subcollections, following the principle of homogeneous security posture. Authorization Independence is achieved by avoiding `get()` calls in rules and enabling atomic creation of parent/child documents using path-based ownership.
